benchmark_details.name: MLR-Bench
benchmark_details.overview: MLR-Bench is a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating AI agents on open-ended machine learning research. It includes 201 research tasks, an automated evaluation framework called MLR-Judge, and a modular agent called MLR-Agent to conduct research across multiple stages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a systematic framework for evaluating AI agents in conducting open-ended machine learning research, improving their reliability and transparency.

data.source: 201 real-world research tasks sourced from NeurIPS, ICLR, and ICML workshops.

methodology.calculation: Each research output is evaluated based on criteria such as clarity, consistency, and novelty.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in evaluating AI-generated research indicate better performance in producing quality research outputs.
methodology.validation: Validated through human evaluations showing high agreement with expert reviewers.
